positive.review: Wow... I sat down to play this game yesterday, hear I am 26.1 hrs later. How I was able to relive the joy I felt gaming as a kid again, it rekindled the spark in my heart for gaming. I had all my snacks and drinks lined up, I was so immersed and engaged for the entirety of that time, to the point where time just slipped away. So I warn you now, sore and all, this game is an unbeatable experience. Salute to the sailors in Subs I'm dying just simulating what you all do. 10/10 game will unplug from reality with it again!!!

Pretty solid game, good SH3 successor, however I think developer did not get enough money as they expected, so there are not many updates, sadly. It could use some more (I can pay for a DLC with Type XXI, trust me)

Great game! However, there are still some annoying bugs, e.g., after sinking an aircraft carrier, an enemy “ghost plane” always appears, so my crew has to remain on alert all the time—after a while, they die of exhaustion!
Anyway, I'm looking forward to the "Asia" DLC!

This game is extremely good at realism. Even with AI managing most of the basic tasks, you still have to keep an eye on things. If you're new to sub-sims, then this might be a bit frustrating on your first go round but when you get a direct hit on a merchant ship with a manual input solution, the satisfaction is worth it. 

Also, watch out for the RAF. By 1943, they're a bloody nuisance when you have to surface your boat to get some fresh air.

Great game hitting the sweet spot between realism and entertainment. It’s immersive and really makes you feel like you're commanding a submarine. The feeling when a torpedo hits an enemy ship after all that tense waiting is priceless.

Even though there are some pretty glaring faults in the game logic or behavior here and there, and certain spots where you can almost 'cheat' your way through - and stuff like snow on the shores in the summer or whatever - this is still by far the most enjoyable and clever U-boat simulation I've tried. You just need to take it seriously and let yourself immerse in it, and it will reward. There are few games I've bothered to play thru twice, and even fewer I've played three times thru the campaign, and this is one of those. No doubt I will play a fourth round as well. Just an excellent and beautiful a game.
Very fun so far, I like the fact that crew gain exp and that there is a tech tree to research.

Great game.

This submarine sim is accessible enough for someone like me, and a few setting tweaks away making it an authentically hardcore experience. 

I just can't pore over translated user manuals from 1940 for all the devices aboard my VIIC, I'm not gonna break out the calculator for my torpedo launches, I'm simply not. 

But I'm clearly on my way to doing that. 

After learning a ton of nautical terms and concepts, I've begun reading about naval doctrine and how it evolved as WW2 progressed so I can better "prosecute my targets". This game just sucked me in.

I also like to be called Korvettenkapitän in real life as I play this game but that's a different matter altogether.

The experience of hunting a convoy for hours of (in-game) time, waiting for the right opportunity, letting off some torps and scurrying away into the depths is just one of the many immersive experiences this game gave me. 

A little rough around the edges but the game nails life aboard a uboat: the monotony, the anxiety, the panic of realizing you're in a steel can 150 m underwater, the relief, the elation.

In short: Yes, I would absolutely recommend this game!

There are few submarine "sim" or "arcade" games around and even fewer that do it (at least partially) right. 
This is one of them!

UBOOT offers a captivating mix of realistic submarine management and immersive war strategy that will delight fans of simulations and action-packed survival and strategy games alike.

This is an excellent German U-boat game that immerses the player into the life aboard a WW2 submarine as the Captain, tasked to take care of the boat as well as the crew. If you are a beginner I would suggest that you start out with the easiest settings, and review the many tutorials available to guide you in the sometimes chaotic and confusing environment. Once you get the hang of things, there are dozens of excellent mods that are available that enhance the realism, graphics, and maritime experience. The Discussion forum will provide answers from dedicated players with far more experience than myself when you might hit snags along the way.
U-Boat is still a game in progress, and an update is promised soon that will expand the U-Boat roster and patrol areas.

Recommended!

I absolutely recommend this game wether you are someone who loves u boats like me, or someone who loves naval warfare during wwii, or someone who is just looking for a fun game to play and enjoys a bit of a challenge, this game is for you. From tracking down ships to laying down mines, landing spies in the uk and Ireland, making weather stations, doing patrols, sinking ships to looking for sunken treasure you will definitely have great fun if you just give it a try. Now i will say that the tutorial doesn’t really explain everything, specially if you are playing on higher realism, they don’t tell you how to track down ships, make your own torpedo calculations (which you should do as its usually more accurate but also more complex), how to approach your target and how the torpedoes work, for example i didn’t know that you could use magnetic triggers for torpedoes. They give you a good general idea of how to play but I do recommend that you find a good beginners guide on yt as it will help you a lot and you will need it trust me. Also if you hit your targed and they start doing Tokyo drift or get launched into space or even if they float off through the air, don’t be alarmed as im sure that its not a bug but rather some kind of defensive tactic. Have a good day and good hunting skipper

This game is something else.
It WILL take days of your life.
The mechanics are in depth and enjoyable, and you can play as realistically or arcadey as you want.
From making all torpedo calculations manual, to being able to just teleport back to port when your mission is over, its up to you
the story is long and can be a bit tedious, but i think that's the point. With the first campaign starting at the start of ww2 in 1939 and going all the way to 1945. Each day of the war is passed in sped up time (or real time if you're literally insane) with your missions and patrols not having any loading screens, you sail from France to the United States, encountering convoys and planes, all without having to pause.
a few bugs here and there and i almost went terminal velocity on a bugged mission.  10/10

Pretty good so far, looking forward to what the Type IX can do when that releases.

With some sequences on missions you can really feel the scripting however - one the objective is complete, enemy warships just happen to show up. I'm also not the biggest fan of having some of the main missions be timed things - if you want to complete those, best thing to do is just go for the objective and then head back home, and not just take initiative to roam more around to potentially find some good targets.

With travel, refuel and restock times, you otherwise may run out of time to complete some of the objectives. I'm personally also not the biggest fan of the restock mechanic in that it is random which torpedo types, and how many, are available. If you don't want to mix and match, you sometimes get into the habit of loading just the types you want, then after the loading process is complete check the stock again, which changed.

I'm not really sure it really adds much to the game.

It’s like when you're a real doctor and watch a medical soap opera: you immediately notice all the inaccuracies, and it completely breaks the immersion.
It’s the same with this game: if you’re even remotely interested in submarine history or submarine warfare, the game quickly just feels dumb.

Besides, HORRIBLE animations (I mean it. Check gameplay footage if you dont believe me), really poor voice acting, poor ship and U-Boat models. 
As for gameplay, it does have nice ideas, like having a lot more different tasks than just outright sinking ships, but still, the poor immersion killed it for me before I even got to finish the tutorial.

I tried to like it ..but the more I played the clunky camera in port trying to get it to move to where I wanted ..frustrating as hell if ever a free camera was needed ...the crew management drove me nuts to start with all seemed fine ..but soon it did my head in couldnt find how to do stuff spent most of my time on google trying to figure it out talk about over complicate ..everything ...what a ballache of a game and a disapointment seen it thought ohh this looks fun ..no  ..its not ...the fun went when you turned it into a 9 - 5 job with no pay and the tools given to do said job constantly break ... at this point I want to do something completely different.. pity it looked good . not what was expected ..but I did give it a fair crack before review

This game runs horribly. It turns into a slideshow any time I use the binoculars or attack scope, even on the lowest settings.

It has some good mechanics like the first person mode, but the numerous bugs and performance issues make this an unfun experence.

It’s like when you're a real doctor and watch a medical soap opera: you immediately notice all the inaccuracies, and it completely breaks the immersion.
It’s the same with this game: if you’re even remotely interested in submarine history or submarine warfare, the game quickly just feels dumb.

Besides, HORRIBLE animations (I mean it. Check gameplay footage if you dont believe me), really poor voice acting, poor ship and U-Boat models. 
As for gameplay, it does have nice ideas, like having a lot more different tasks than just outright sinking ships, but still, the poor immersion killed it for me before I even got to finish the tutorial.


I bought this because I was a fan of Silent Hunter III back in the day and was excited to see a modern u-boat game finally. But it's trash. I just go back to modded SH3.

this game is actually unplayable i input every single correct input and still my torpedo is too short. I try everything to make my torpedo move a little to the right and yet nothing. I don't know how the devs could allow this pile of dog shit to be on steam but i actually spend a entire hour trying to sink a single ship on a broken game. do not even try with this game.

The game talks about how they have ideas for defeating the Sonar. Never say what those are. You just die the moment a ship with weapons is around. Maybe work on that tutorial devs have a live fire mission or two.
completely useless you can't do anything even in bloody training & resupply it has you buy 3 torpedeos but loading the torpedeos takes literally hours to show any progress it's redictulous.
My fps was crashing to single digits. So sorry can't recommend. Had to ask for a refund.
